page.title: 16Religion-The Astons
page.content: In Aston Tirrold is the church of St Michael. A church has existed on this site since 1080 and it has links with the Torold family who gave their name to the village. All Saints Church, Aston Upthorpe dates from Saxon times and the church stands on the site of an earlier church. This could be the place where King Ethelred remained at prayer while his brother Alfred defeated the Danes at the Battle of Assendune(Ashdown). In 1862 separate parishes of Upton and Aston Upthorpe were formed. The United Reformed Church of Aston Tirrold was built in 1782 in brick and was a Presbyterian Church until 1972. It is the second oldest Non Conformist Church building in Berkshire. The first school started in the village in 1827 based on the Church.
